title: Explainable Concept Generation through Vision-Language Preference Learning for Understanding Neural Networks' Internal Representations
authors: Aditya Taparia, Som Sagar, Ransalu Senanayake
description: We propose a Reinforcement Learning-based Preference Optimizing exploration (RLPO) method designed to generate explainable states within a classification model, enabling the discovery of interpretable states that may be difficult or impossible for humans to identify.

title: BaTCAVe: Trustworthy Explanations for Robot Behaviors
authors: Som Sagar*, Aditya Taparia*, Harsh Mankodiya, Pranav Bidare, Yifan Zhou, Ransalu Senanayake
venue: IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS)
description: We introduce BaTCAV, a Bayesian TCAV framework with uncertainty estimations that enhances the interpretability of robotic actions across both simulation platforms and real-world robotic systems.

title: VLC Fusion: Vision-Language Conditioned Sensor Fusion for Robust Object Detection
authors: Aditya Taparia, Noel Ngu, Mario Leiva, Joshua Shay Kricheli, John Corcoran, Nathaniel D. Bastian, Gerardo Simari, Paulo Shakarian, Ransalu Senanayake
description: We introduce VLC Fusion, a novel vision-language conditioned sensor fusion framework that enhances object detection robustness by leveraging environmental cues for improving performance.

title: Multiple Distribution Shift-Aerial (MDS-A): A Dataset for Test-Time Error Detection and Model Adaptation
authors: Noel Ngu, Aditya Taparia, Gerardo I. Simari, Mario Leiva, Ransalu Senanayake, Paulo Shakarian, Nathaniel D. Bastian, John Corcoran
description: We present MDS-A, a comprehensive dataset designed for evaluating test-time error detection and model adaptation strategies in aerial imagery scenarios with multiple distribution shifts.

title: ExpressivityArena: Can LLMs Express Information Implicitly?
authors: Joshua Tint, Som Sagar, Aditya Taparia, Caleb Liu, Kelly Raines, Bimsara Pathiraja, Ransalu Senanayake
venue: NeurIPS Workshop on Behavioral Machine Learning
description: We introduce ExpressivityArena, a framework designed to evaluate the expressiveness of large language models (LLMs), enabling systematic assessment of their ability to convey nuanced and implicit information across various contexts.

title: LLM-Assisted Red Teaming of Diffusion Models through "Failures Are Fated, But Can Be Faded"
authors: Som Sagar, Aditya Taparia, Ransalu Senanayake
venue: NeurIPS Workshop on Red Teaming GenAI
description: This extension of the Failures Are Fated work demonstrates how we use LLM-assisted methods to generate rewards and states in diffusion models, and incorporate RL search strategies to optimize the discovery process.

title: Failures Are Fated, But Can Be Faded: Characterizing and Mitigating Unwanted Behaviors in Large-Scale Vision and Language Models
authors: Som Sagar, Aditya Taparia, Ransalu Senanayake
description: We introduce a framework that maps the failure landscape of large vision and language models, addressing their shortcomings by realigning model behavior with human preferences—whether stylistic or ethical—to mitigate failures.
